sentences.english: Out of date from the combination of wandering to, shame more eastward Jun beg.
sentences.chinese: 过时自合飘零去，耻向东君更乞怜。

sentences.english: She crouched low like a fawning dog.
sentences.chinese: 她蜷缩在地上，象只摇尾乞怜的狗。

sentences.english: The sorrowful widow begged for mercy.
An enemy who lies at your feet begging forgiveness must not feel your sword.
sentences.chinese: 对俯伏在你脚下乞怜的敌人，绝不可使他触及你的剑。

sentences.english: An enemy who lies at thy feet begging forgiveness must not feel thy sword.
sentences.chinese: 对俯伏在你脚下乞怜的敌人，绝不可让他触及你的剑。

sentences.english: However, as long as police officers through, it will immediately jump fawning.
sentences.chinese: 不过，只要有员警经过，它就会立刻跳起来摇尾乞怜。

sentences.english: He said he would never grovel before a conqueror.
sentences.chinese: 他说他永远不会在征服者脚下摇尾乞怜。

sentences.english: The puppy was fawning on its master.
sentences.chinese: 小狗向它的主人摇尾乞怜。

sentences.english: They are like a begging of the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他们就象一只摇尾乞怜的丧家之犬。

definition: to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
to seek for/to hope to gain/desirous
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
